Rationale: Americas comparable sales remain negative due to product stagnation; $240M tariff impact and heavy markdowns to clear excess inventory severely compress margins.
International strength offsets soft Americas traffic; Spring 2026 product refresh stabilizes top line while working capital release from inventory clearance boosts FCF despite tariff margin drag.
Spring 2026 launch reinvigorates US demand faster than anticipated; China accelerates; strong price realization and supply chain agility fully offset tariff headwinds.
Product refresh fails to regain lost market share from competitors like Vuori/Alo; China growth slows due to macro headwinds; growth settles at low-single digits.
Full impact of new product assortment restores Americas to positive comps; Men's category gains traction; operational efficiencies and tariff mitigation strategies restore EBIT margins.
Men's category scales rapidly alongside strong adoption of new women's social/lounge styles; international markets outperform; operating leverage drives significant margin expansion.
Company faces structural maturity in North America with commoditized product offerings; reliance on China creates volatility; margins remain permanently compressed.
Sustained international expansion and Men's category growth drive mid-to-high single digit revenue; buyback program supports net income; inventory management normalizes.
Brand successfully dominates the global wellness lifestyle market; accelerated store openings in APAC and Europe drive double-digit top-line growth.
Lululemon operates as a mature ex-growth retailer; limited pricing power due to "dupe" competition prevents margin recovery.
Steady state growth achieved through balanced global portfolio; continued discipline in SG&A and moderate store expansion keeps earnings growth slightly above revenue.
Innovation pipeline creates new category wins (e.g. footwear/accessories); digital ecosystem increases customer lifetime value and retention globally.
Market saturation reached in key international hubs; lack of IP protection allows competitors to erode remaining premium positioning.
Business matures into a steady global cash compounder; China market matures to high-single digit growth; strong cash generation fuels capital returns.
Continued double-digit growth driven by "Rest of World" markets entering hyper-growth phase and sustained dominance in premium performance wear.
Terminal growth assumes inflationary growth only as brand equity fades in a saturated apparel market.
Terminal growth aligns with global GDP and sustained premium brand positioning in a mature athletic apparel sector.
Terminal growth reflects a best-in-class global brand with enduring pricing power and successfully diversified revenue streams.
